results.name: PenthousPrivate room & bath w roof
results.summary: Fabulous Room with your own Bathroom in great Brooklyn Penthouse Apartment. Room is very comfy and private with brand new queen size bed. Apt is fab w private roof, cool living room, AC, TV, Kitchen. C'mon to Brooklyn!
results.space: The space is great. A larger living room area, with great big windows, tv, and a nook kitchen perfectly set up for your culinary talents. *Air conditioning thru out the apartment Large Private Roof patio area with outdoor sectional sofa and views! Your Room: A VERY comfortable Queen size bed, desk, chair, and closet with ample room for storing your suitcase, clothes, personal items. *Room comes with COLD in-window air conditioning unit plus a ceiling fan. Your Bathroom: private and exclusive use of hallway bathroom, replete with clean stand-up shower, sink, faucet, toilet, mirror, linens, soap, shampoo & conditioner. Guests have access to: -tv/living room area -Kitchen and all utensils and accoutrements -private roof terrace -wireless internet The neighborhood is a perfect example of Brooklyn living. Still gentrifying but safe and hip. At first glance it might be a bit intimidating but it's not, it's just an excellent representation of the diversity and coolness that NYC has to offer.

results.name: Luxurious 1BR Best Views in NYC!
results.summary: Incredible New York City apt in doorman building with stunning views of Freedom Tower and the Hudson. Great Kitchen. Large living room with flat screen TV. King-size bedroom. Conveniently located to 9/11 Museum, Battery Park, Restaurants, and Shops.
results.space: Forget you are in the most bustling city in the world while staying in this Battery Park City oasis, conveniently located to the Freedom Tower, 9/11 Museum, views of the Statue of Liberty and all subways to get anywhere you want to go! This spacious one bedroom has enough room for luxurious couple living or a comfortable family set up. The building has a doorman for added security, private parks and a gorgeous outdoor swimming pool (25 entry fee). The bedroom: King size bed | AC/Heat Unit | Views of Marina and Freedom Tower The living room: L shaped couch accommodates 4 comfortably (or two for sleeping) | New 60 flat screen with access to Netflix and itunes (tv just upgraded and not pictured) | Views of Marina and Freedom Tower | Plenty of room for an air mattress (will be provided if you need one) Dining Room: Seats 4 for a beautiful dinner party or family dinner Kitchen: Brand new stainless steel GE appliances | marble counter tops | breakfast seating for 2

results.neighborhood_overview: This neighborhood is very up and coming with new and trendy restaurants popping up every day that serve a wide range of cuisines and prices. It's also the best neighborhood in the city for kids and dogs. The apartment sits across the street from the 9/11 Museum and Freedom Tower (far enough away though to be out of the crowds). You will be just a few blocks away from the New York Stock Exchange, Brooklyn Bridge, Stone Street, East River, Battery Park, South Street Seaport, the ferries to Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island and trendy TriBeCa shopping.
results.transit: Fast and easy access to all of Manhattan, Brooklyn, Queens, Staten Island and New Jersey with less than a 5 min walk to nearly all of the major subway lines in New York including: 4, 5, 6, A, C, 1, 2, 3
results.access: I'm flexible on check-in times. Check-out is also very simple. The door locks automatically so all you have to do is leave the keys on the bed and you're all set!

results.name: The Happy home!
results.space: Welcome to NYC ! :) Our apartment is located in a family neighborhood in Manhattan 10min walking distance to Central Park, 5min away from the Subway, Downtown/Uptown Bus stop located across the street, and few minutes from Supermarkets, clothing stores, and 24/7 grocery store located across the street. We will as well of course recommend you the best restaurants in the neighborhood. We welcome up to two guests per night. On Subway it takes only 10min to be in Midtown Manhattan and all that NYC has to offer, such as the amazing Museums, Broadway shows, and shopping! The place itself is very quiet, and we provide Internet access for your convenience. Let us know if you have any questions! Best wishes, Léna and Lamine

We love great food, workout ( Running, biking, swimming, yoga...), getting to know new people, and different cultures. We are very open minded, happy, and outgoing people. We can't wait to meet you! Best wishes, Lena and Lamine

results.summary: Very conveniently located in South Harlem with great light and lots of space, family oriented neighborhood, 2 minutes walk to the subway, banks, pharmacy, grocery stores, supermarkets and new happening restaurants. 10mn walk from Central Park. This place is unique by its location, you are in the middle of the hip Central Harlem, less than 15mn from Times Square and yet in the backyard you can hear the birds and you can rest from a hectic visit around New York city.
results.space: This incredibly home located in accessible and filled with young people and family's neighborhood. with lots of new restaurants, coffee shops and galleries. It's close to Central Park, a mile to many of the major museums, including the MET, within a 3-5 min walk to two subway stops and several bus lines, and close to everything in the City without being in a tourist area! Large 4 bedroom/1bathroom walk up building, located in prime area. The apt is on the 4th floor (no elevator). There are large 4 bedrooms and 1 bathroom. Nice size kitchen and it has everything you'll need for your cooking needs. Other features include: -L shape sofa bed in the livingroom - 55'' High Definition Smart TV with cable - High Speed WiFi - Fully equipped Kitchen: Refrigerator,Oven, Stove, Microwave, Toaster, Coffee maker, Dishwasher and cooking and dining utensils - Clean linens and towels - Sofabed for extra guests - Iron and hair dryer Bedroom 1: - Queen sized bed with memory foam mattress - Linens and tow

results.neighborhood_overview: East Harlem (El Barrio or Spanish Harlem, if you prefer) is growing accustomed to receiving visitors. This neighborhood’s vibrant roots are depicted through its large-scale murals, discussed in its museums, and revered by its members. The draw of its deep seeded traditions is matched by superb subway accessibility. Although East Harlem is gaining notoriety as a neighborhood to watch, it’s still raw at its core—especially after sunset.
results.notes: Check in is at 2:00 pm & check out is at 11:00 am please keep this in mind when booking your flights. YOU WILL BE SUBJECTED TO A LATE CHECK-IN FEE IF YOU ARRIVE PAST 8:00 PM

results.name: Queenszbds, Skyline view,prvt room.
results.summary: My cozy and convenient apartment is only a short walk from the train,central park,shopping and museums! Enjoy NYC at your fingertips and fall asleep with a skyline view from your bed!
results.space: My space is a comfortable and calm escape from the Craziness that is New York City. I want you to feel at home while staying with me. The skyline view doesn't hurt either! I also have my energy supplied from an all green company so you can feel good knowing your stay here is not contributing to any additional pollution or harm to the earth :)
results.description: My cozy and convenient apartment is only a short walk from the train,central park,shopping and museums! Enjoy NYC at your fingertips and fall asleep with a skyline view from your bed! My space is a comfortable and calm escape from the Craziness that is New York City. I want you to feel at home while staying with me. The skyline view doesn't hurt either! I also have my energy supplied from an all green company so you can feel good knowing your stay here is not contributing to any additional pollution or harm to the earth :) You will have access to the bathroom kitchen living room etc. I have wifi internet as well. There is a gym across the street that does free 3 day passes too! 90% of the time I will be present during your stay however occasionally i must leave town (generally once a month). if i am not home i am still more than happy to help with directions or advice on places to go and you will have a local emergency contact as well which will be the same woman that will check you
results.neighborhood_overview: My neighborhood is close to so many amazing things in nyc. Museum mile is 2 train stops, central park is 2 blocks away (the conservatory garden is gorgeous all year round). Madison Avenue is a short walk and the corner I live on has plenty of shopping, a gym and a grocery store across the street. My neighborhood is a mostly Hispanic/Spanish speaking area so the food is also amazing! The train is also a 2 minute walk from my apartment so the entire city is very easily accessed!
results.notes: There are stairs (no elevator/lift) in my building and the apartment is on the 5th floor(only 4 sets of steps) if your arrival is after 10pm there will be a 40 late check in fee.
results.transit: The train is a short 2 minute walk from the apartment. But most things are within walking distance. I've found the easiest way to arrive from Laguardia is by taxi cab. It runs about 30-35 including tip. JFK will be around 65 and i do not recommend taking a taxi from Newark. public transit times are 45 min from LGA 90 min from JFK and 2 hours from newark. if you're looking for a cheaper taxi alternative I personally take VIA which is a taxi sharing service that's a flat rate from both JFK and LGA. they're not 24 hours but they operate most of the day and when you sign up and put in my code you'll get a free 10 ride credit so your ride from the airport is really cheap! here's the info: I ride with Via, you should too! Use my code, sarahjane7a3, to get 10 of free credit. Download the app here: (URL HIDDEN)
results.access: You will have access to the bathroom kitchen living room etc. I have wifi internet as well. There is a gym across the street that does free 3 day passes too!
results.interaction: 90% of the time I will be present during your stay however occasionally i must leave town (generally once a month). if i am not home i am still more than happy to help with directions or advice on places to go and you will have a local emergency contact as well which will be the same woman that will check you in. when i am out of town i rent both bedrooms in my apartment :)
results.house_rules: no shoes in the apartment no smoking inside 25 key replacement so please do not lose them! each guest will get 1 towel for your stay, if you take more you will be charged an additional cleaning charge. also, do not take my towels please. if the garbage becomes full during your stay, take it outside. you may not ship things to my home. i cannot guarantee that i will be home for delivery and your package might get lost or held at the post office/returned. you may not bring anyone to my home that is not part of your airbnb stay. strangers met in nyc are never allowed in my home/building and family/friends must be agreed upon before giving my address etc. please maintain correct attire in the common areas of my home, respect that although it might be common where you live, not everyone will be as comfortable with nudity as you are. i have people from all cultures staying with me. there are plenty of laundromats in NYC and a full load costs about 5. please do not do laundry in the sink
results.host_location: New York, New York, United States
results.host_about: I'm a hairstylist that has a passion for travel, nature and animals. I'm from Chicago originally but fully believe that home is where you are at any given moment... I have a cat named Princess Boots that is shy but owns my heart. I love reading random 1 books from flea markets and walking around central park as much as possible. I'm vegan and I love to cook! Finally, I choose to wake up every morning happy and make sure no matter what happens through out my day that I go to bed the same way. Peace, love and adventure!

results.name: Monthly Apartment Rental
results.summary: This is a very comfortable one bedroom apartment available for rent :-) The train and bus are just two to three very short blocks away :-)
results.space: This is a one bedroom apartment. All the pictures above are accurate and taken by airbnb. This apartment is practically perfect! It has all you'll need :-)) and it's just comfortable and feels like home! It has three big windows in the front and three big windows in the back :-)) You can either come here while your in transition to a new apartment or just lay back and vacation! It's an apartment that really works for whatever occasion you might have. Our area's proximity to mid-town Manhattan, makes it one of New York's most desirable residential neighborhoods. What sets the Upper East apart from all other areas is it's closeness to Madison Avenue & Park Avenue. Madison Avenue is famously known as the world's premier shopping district for the finest food, opulent merchandise, luxury lodging and services available anywhere. results.name: Spacious Rm in 3br apt-private bath
results.summary: Sunny room with queen air mattress, two large windows, and exposed brick is the perfect place to call home while traveling the city. Marble bath with bathtub and shower, kitchen, living room, terrace, and in unit laundry are all yours to use.
results.space: We love our apartment! Hardwood floors, exposed brick, new appliances and a cozy living space, plus a lovely private terrace to have an evening drink, or breakfast. Also, the building has an elevator, though there are 2 stairs up to enter the building from the outside. The room is unfurnished except for a plush queen air mattress, and full closet. Lots more space than shown in the photos!
results.description: Sunny room with queen air mattress, two large windows, and exposed brick is the perfect place to call home while traveling the city. Marble bath with bathtub and shower, kitchen, living room, terrace, and in unit laundry are all yours to use. We love our apartment! Hardwood floors, exposed brick, new appliances and a cozy living space, plus a lovely private terrace to have an evening drink, or breakfast. Also, the building has an elevator, though there are 2 stairs up to enter the building from the outside. The room is unfurnished except for a plush queen air mattress, and full closet. Lots more space than shown in the photos! Feel free to cook in our cute kitchen (with dishwasher!), hang out in the living room or on the terrace, enjoy your own private marble bath with bathtub/shower, and use our in-unit washing machine and dryer. You'll also have your own big closet. There are 2 people who live in the apartment, though if a room is available, one or more of the residents may not be
results.neighborhood_overview: Great neighborhood just a short walk to the East River and to Central Park. Quiet street with families nestled in a vibrant community. Apartment is right around the corner from the grocery store and pharmacy. Mexican, Thai, Chinese, Pizza, and cafes within minutes.
results.transit: Very convenient location Five minute walk to M96 bus crosstown. Eight minutes to the 6 train. Steps from the M15 bus.
results.access: Feel free to cook in our cute kitchen (with dishwasher!), hang out in the living room or on the terrace, enjoy your own private marble bath with bathtub/shower, and use our in-unit washing machine and dryer. You'll also have your own big closet.
results.interaction: There are 2 people who live in the apartment, though if a room is available, one or more of the residents may not be there. In general, we're there to recommend some things to do or see, and you'll often find us hanging out in the living room with a cup of tea, or cooking in the kitchen. Your privacy in the room is your own.
results.house_rules: We take pride in our apartment, and ask that you respect and take care of the space. You are quite welcome to use the kitchen and fridge, but please clean up after yourselves. Kindly keep your voices down if coming in late, and please don't smoke or use drugs in the apartment.

results.name: Manhattan Brownstone B and B
results.summary: A warm and inviting, home-like B&B, we offer a restorative, enriching and peaceful way to experience Manhattan life. We are particularly well set-up for large families or for extended families to share NYC together, offering something for every age.
results.space: There is a large studio apartment with a kitchenette; a suite with queen tempur-pedic sofa bed, full bath, 3D TV with surround sound system, terrace (and hammock) plus library with aquarium; and a children's playroom filled with toys with bunk beds and a crib. Each of the bedrooms other than the children's is 175 per night (the children's is 100). A continental breakfast, New York magazines, wifi and cable are included. There is also a heated, year-round indoor pool/jacuzzi and a private garden and fountain (with tree house!). This brownstone is one of many on a quiet, tree-lined block between Lexington and Park - with free street-parking available. Half a block away is the neighborhood's ZRestaurant Row which lines Lexington Avenue from 99th to 102nd Streets. Mt. Sinai Hospital is a block away as the crow flies and many museums throng Fifth Avenue, which - together with Central Park - is two blocks away.
results.description: A warm and inviting, home-like B&B, we offer a restorative, enriching and peaceful way to experience Manhattan life. Half a block away is the neighborhood's Restaurant Row which lines Lexington Ave
results.neighborhood_overview: This block is a calmer retreat from the high-energy assault of midtown; but there are a number of excellent restaurants here. A play street in the summer has meant that the diverse residents have developed close relationships over the years.
results.transit: The Lexington Avenue Subway (#6 Train) is two blocks away. There is downtown bus service one block away.
results.access: Guests have access to all the public areas of the house: the stoop and halls, the dining room, garden and sunroom, and the basement with pool.
results.interaction: We let the guests set the pace and frequency of interaction. We are always available but most often see our guests over breakfast.
results.house_rules: No one should swim alone and there is ABSOLUTELY no diving.
results.host_location: New York, New York, United States
results.host_about: When I was a little girl growing up in the South, I always used to fantasize that I was a child in New York City. I would envision myself roller skating to school, going to see the Christmas tree in Rockefeller Center or swimming at the beach on Coney Island. By the time I was four, I was determined to move to New York City when I grew up. Which I did. And I raised my own four children here on a diverse block with the whole city as their school and playground. They are all grown up now and their rooms lie empty. The treehouse from which one could see Central Park is still in our backyard; their video games are still in the play loft we built for them; many of their surviving toys are in the room where my grandchildren play when they come to visit. But for days on end no children are here. Meanwhile there are children all over the world who grow up with images of New York on their TV screens, in their books and in their movies. They, too, want to experience the city for themselves. And their parents want to bring them; but there are no other affordable accommodations specifically designed for families. The only children who ever get to see New York are the offspring of the 1%. At this B&B, families can strengthen their bonds and create lifelong memories together as they visit all the iconic New York sites: The Statue of Liberty, Times Square, The Museum of Natural History. But their children are also getting a taste of what it's like to be a New York City kid: playing stoop ball off our front steps, running through the sprinkler on our play street, eating ices off the corner hand truck. In short, AIRBNB is New York City's ambassador to future generations. Who knows? They may grow up and bring their kids here to see this city, too, someday.
results.street: East Harlem, New York, NY 10029, United States

results.name: Charming 1 BR in the heart of Chelsea/West Village
results.summary: This is a classic New York City tenement style building located in one of the most popular areas of NYC. It borders Chelsea, the West Village, the Meatpacking District and blocks from Union Square and Soho.
results.space: This is a one bedroom apartment with beautiful hardwood floors though-out. The bedroom is quite large, the living room is on the smaller side, but nice. Very artsy, cozy and a little bohemian. NOT modern but very charming and very clean. Note This is a three floor walk up and no elevator. What you get: - Very Comfy Queen Sized Bed - Bedding/sheets and towels - Wifi Access - Hardwood floors throughout. - You get your own garment and shoe rack - Use of a dresser - Living room with large sofa and and large flat screen television. - Kitchenette with refrigerator, stove, sink. - Dish-ware, pots, pans, iron, toiletries - Bathroom is standard with a claw-foot tub, windows more than welcome to use all shampoos, toiletries (blowdryer), etc. - Air Conditioning - Four Laundromats within a two block radius, including one in the building (Drop-off only) - There is a very pleasant, well-mannered cat on the premises
results.description: This is a classic New York City tenement style building located in one of the most popular areas of NYC. It borders Chelsea, the West Village, the Meatpacking District and blocks from Union Square and Soho. This is a one bedroom apartment with beautiful hardwood floors though-out. The bedroom is quite large, the living room is on the smaller side, but nice. Very artsy, cozy and a little bohemian. NOT modern but very charming and very clean. Note This is a three floor walk up and no elevator. What you get: - Very Comfy Queen Sized Bed - Bedding/sheets and towels - Wifi Access - Hardwood floors throughout. - You get your own garment and shoe rack - Use of a dresser - Living room with large sofa and and large flat screen television. - Kitchenette with refrigerator, stove, sink. - Dish-ware, pots, pans, iron, toiletries - Bathroom is standard with a claw-foot tub, windows more than welcome to use all shampoos, toiletries (blowdryer), etc. - Air Conditioning - Four Laundro
results.neighborhood_overview: My apartment borders Chelsea and the West Village. It's a few blocks from Meatpacking District, Union Square, Chelsea Market, Chelsea Piers, the High Line, Hudson River Park ( where you can ride your Citi Bike and Citi Bikes are everywhere and one station right across the street! ) Tons of restaurants, delis, cafes, banks and supermarkets (one conveniently located right downstairs), and very, very close access to ALL subways. SERIOUSLY, A GREAT AREA! Also, the Whitney Museum just opened in the Meat Packing District (a bout a 7-10 minute walk and Chelsea Market is 5 minute walking distance.
results.notes: - Note: (The bedroom and living room are separated by a regular wall, however in lieu of a door there is a thick, very private doubled curtain that keeps out light and most noise) - Note: I sleep on the couch in the living room and you would have to walk by me at night to use the restroom. I have nightlight throughout the space so you can see. I sleep through everything and not an issue, but if this is an issue for you then it's probably not the right space for you. - Note: A big, healthy lovable cat on the premises, so must be a cat lover!
results.transit: I am very, very close to all of the subways (1,2,3 train around the corner), A,C,E one block away, F, M one block away, and Union Square subway N, R, and 4,5,6 Trains are three to four blocks away. Also, Citi Bikes are all over the place and one station is right across the street. There is a beautiful riding path along the Hudson river that is about four blocks away.
results.access: Access to all common spaces: bathroom, kitchenette, and living room
results.interaction: I am more than happy to help you, and you can text me anytime if I am not home.
results.house_rules: Keep the apartment as clean as you found it. No parties (do people still do that?) and just treat the place with respect. Thanks.
